item.title: Home
item.content:encoded:
Euphoric food, wine, and life experiences

Bespoke Services

Private Dining

Meticulously paired multi-course experiences from our worldwide wanderings. We bring the world right to your table.

Wine & Spirits Sourcing

As fanatical finders, we will cross the world, fetch your favorites and hard-to-gets, and bring them right to your door. Weâ€™ll also introduce you to new ones.

International Travel Guide

We wander for love of it. We wander for you. We will even meet you there and wander with you. Where should we meet?

Mission

To elevate life and human connections through unforgettable shared experiences with food, wine and world wandering.

To bring the world to your table.

About

Born to do this - Rock drummer / international flavor chaser turned tech entrepreneur - turned private chef and wine / spirits collector. Joseph Rohan speaks to the joy of living nine lives and the beauty of coming full circle over the things that really matter.

A Word From Guests

  • â€œHaving Joe as our chef and guide in Champagne and Bordeaux was a stellar experience. We discovered so much more of each of these areas because of it and his meals were just amazing. His ability to sample and then quickly master regional dishes is uncanny.â€

    Dr. Dave McConoughey, ICU Medical Director at St. John Medical Center

  • â€œJoe wields his knowledge of wine, skillet and the travel world with equal prowess. It brought my recent trip to Spain to life at an entirely different level. Honestly, the best octopus dish Iâ€™ve ever had was the one he served at my own AirBnB. He also stopped in Portugal on his way over and picked up some treats. He just loves to go the extra mile. Amazing talent and top executive level service. Great picks for my wine cellar too.â€

    Mark Loder, Financial Advisor at Wells Fargo

  • â€œItâ€™s always exciting right before a Joe Plates event, wondering what new wines I will try, and what new flavors I will add to my memory. Itâ€™s just so much more than a regular dinner gathering or event. Joe Plates has become an anchor for staying connected with my closest friends and family."

    Ali King, Director, Burton D Morgan Mentoring Programs at Jumpstart

  • â€œSuper high-end with an industrial edge, thatâ€™s how I would describe the Joe Plates experience. Whether it's caviar or a huge tomahawk steak over fire, he just conjures up the most amazing food and pairings - and experiences. And I love the â€œcustomer groupâ€ idea. It enabled my friends and I to participate affordably and still experience the full value of service.â€

    Tony Guerra, Owner at FINCA, LTD.

  • â€œI have used Joe for multiple events for my clients as well as personal guests. He always contributes something to the menu that becomes a showstopper. He knows his wines too and knows where to find them. As a starting collector and frequent event host I value this greatly."

    Aaron Christopher, â€œACâ€ Evans, CEO at Drips.com

  • â€œIf you entertain a few times a year, travel at least once a year, and collect anything thatâ€™s fun or precious to you at all, Joe Plates is a no-brainer. Itâ€™s like an annual guarantee for fun and quality of life experience!"

    Sarah Cargill, Founder at Statement Co.

  • â€œIn the world of 'I know a guy,' I feel like I know THE guy!â€

    Kevin McNulty, Retired

Seeking Diners, Collectors and Wanderers

From one-off Signature Dining Events to Annual Membership Packages, we are seeking new customers, global partners and friends.

Services

  1. Private dining, signature wine and food pairing dinners and events

  2. Worldwide dining (ANY LOCATION worldwide)

  3. Cooking classes

  4. Private wine / spirits tastings, wine courses and wine events

  5. Custom wine / spirits sourcing

  6. Executive sourcing - fine collectibles

  7. Bespoke travel and life experience design

  8. Guided travel services

View the full Services list

item.title: Inspiration
item.content:encoded:
Euphoric Life Experiences =

Food, Wine, Travel & Exploration, mixed with Deliberate Acts of Human Kindness

Contact us to book an event, request information or learn about annual member packages

Call: 216-538-7576 / email: info@joeplates.com

item.title: About
item.content:encoded:
About

Across nine lives and their seemingly disconnected chapters, the story of JoePlates founder Joseph Rohan reads less like chance and more like a serendipitous journey - Cruise ship adventure pioneer, world-touring rock musician, tech entrepreneur, distinctly different indeed. But connecting them all were late-night wanderings and gatherings with chefs and sommeliers and food and wine lovers from around the world, moments where stories, flavors, and friendship became the quiet through-line of a larger and more purposeful journey. Food, wine, exploration, human camaraderie, all had the greater and more infectious grip on Rohan from the very beginning.

Rather than a diversion from this path, these chapters built steadily toward it. The pioneering spirit from the early years at sea, the joy of performance, the endless curiosity of entrepreneurship â€” all converged in the place that mattered most, bringing people together and building unforgettable memories. Behind each bite, sip, or horizon is a memory of experience made sweeter by sharing with others â€” a midnight bite of croquetas in Seville, Spain, a stroll through Bordeauxâ€™s oldest vineyards, the wide expanse of the Scottish Highlands. These moments compelled Rohan to launch Joe Plates, first as a part time pursuit of passion, now as a dedicated calling, to elevate life experience for others through food, wine, exploration, and each other.

Today, Joe Plates is a high-touch service brand for those who want more than just a meal, a trip, or a bottle. We offer private dining, collector wine and spirits sourcing, bespoke travel experiences, and cultural discovery â€” all inspired, all personalized, all designed to stir the soul.

This isnâ€™t about checking boxes. Itâ€™s about creating your own. Whether that means a private tasting in your home, a moonlit dinner at your favorite location, or a highly prized and handpicked collectible arriving from halfway around the world, Joe Plates exists to elevate life â€” one â€œplateâ€ at a time.

item.title: Contact
item.content:encoded:
Letâ€™s Talk

We are excited to meet you, to learn your story and discover how to create an amazing experience for you. Call or send an inquiry using the information below and we will respond quickly â€¦.. and with high enthusiasm!

Phone
(216) 538-7576

Email

Info@joeplatescom

Hours
Mondayâ€“Saturday
10amâ€“6pm

Instagram

Dine, Drink, Wander, Savor, Give Thanks

Dine, Drink, Wander, Savor, Give Thanks

item.title: Wine & Spirits Curation
item.content:encoded:
Wine & Spirits

We are fanatical curators. We will help you

discover your tastes and build your collection.

Or, we will simply cross the world, fetch your

favorites and hard-to-gets, and bring them to

you.

Building a cellar or a collection? Letâ€™s talk!

Whether youâ€™re a novice or an aficionado, building a custom wine cellar requires planning, expertise, and access to exceptional products â€” and Joe Plates delivers all three.

Leveraging established relationships with domestic and international suppliers and a handpicked selection of small-production, high-demand producers, we design and curate cellars tailored to your style, palate, and desired volume. In select cases, we personally acquire rare and hard-to-find wines through scheduled international travel, ensuring your collection grows in both value and distinction.

Enter your email address to receive news and updates and tales from travels.

Thank you!

item.title: Packages
item.content:encoded:
Packages

Joe Plates was built on meaningful relationships and unforgettable life experiences â€” the kind that linger long after the last toast. Weâ€™re always seeking those shared moments that connect people and create stories worth telling for years to come.

But every great relationship has a beginning. Whether youâ€™re planning a one-time celebration, sourcing something rare and remarkable, or dreaming up a signature culinary adventure, we love being part of those starting points â€” the sparks that lead to something lasting.

For those who collect, entertain, and travel often, our annual membership packages offer the best value and access to exclusive experiences, curated events, and personal service all year long.

To learn more about our annual packages, call 216-538-7576 or email info@joeplates.com

Enter your email address to receive news and updates and tales from travels.

Thank you!

item.title: The Barbaric Yawp and Beginning
item.content:encoded:
October, 2024

Iâ€™m sitting in a small hotel cafe in Bordeaux, France with my dear friend, Dave (known to all as Dr. Dave) looking out over the old square, the fountain, the river, sipping on an Armagnac from 1975. Itâ€™s one of those moments where thereâ€™s not much to say. Life is pretty much perfect. People are moving to and fro and about around us like battery operated puzzle pieces, each with a clear picture of their destination. The square maintains a quiet bustle, just busy enough to be entertaining. Dr. Dave and I tip our glasses to each other with a nodding recognition of satisfaction. we talked about this for almost a year, sketched it out over multiple meals and late nights and Google Searches and YouTube vids. It was his dream to come back here and to make all of this happen, right down to the very moment we were sharing. Dave had a knack for planning down to the micro detail.

I gaze over at my friend, who has become my hero over the time I have known him and take in a deep breath of gratitude. For the last two years I have been Daveâ€™s private chef - turned friend - turned close confidante and now, brother. Dave has a vicious version of cancer. The kind that makes one cringe when it gets called it out. The â€œoh no, not that oneâ€ cancer.

Cancer aside, we are still a modern model for symbiosis. We love to hike and explore. We love to be surrounded by good people. Iâ€™m obsessed with food and cooking and wine - and WOW, CAN HE EAT! Anything, all of it, French, Spanish, German, Thai - and always with an almost ferocious display of gratitude. The celebration of food, wine and camaraderie are our mutual livesâ€™ catharsis and a cornerstone of the cancer defiant bubble we have created - a fantastic bubble filled with good souls, endless gatherings, days on the lake and on wooded trails, late night movies and a constant scheming for adventures and getaways (even when mobility and other hinderances interrupted) all leading up to this present escape and our current location. And here we sit, savoring. â€œPromise me you will keep doing this,â€ Dave speaks after a long pause.

â€œKeep doing what?â€ I reply.

â€œTHIS!, Dave repeats passionately, â€œTHIS! Doing this for people. Food and wine and, you know, all of this almost â€œlife conciergeâ€ stuff. Look at what we have built over the last years. The people, the relationships, the memories, the meals. Itâ€™s like a small model for the way people are supposed to live, the way we should celebrate being alive, and with the realization that it doesnâ€™t last forever, that we are just here for a short time. A really short time.â€

I look away trying to disguise my eyes welling up. Fuck, Iâ€™m going to miss this guy. He has no clue of his impact on the world and on every human being that encounters him, right down to me. He is a walking model for triumphant living, blazing a trail of gratitude no matter what lifeâ€™s circumstances have delivered. Only once have I seen frustration take him in almost 3 years and a continuous stream of â€œhealing but not healedâ€ diagnosis.

â€œAnd the thing is, you LOVE this,â€™ Dave continues. Itâ€™s like you were born to do this, cook, travel, bring people together, show up like Santa Claus with a big bag of goodies. It just fits you, and it brings so much happiness. Iâ€™m serious. Promise me.

I stared ahead pensively letting Dr. Daveâ€™s words saturate. Taking a drink of my Armagnac, I felt it roll down my throat, warm, smooth and velvety with just a slight burn. I returned Dr. Daveâ€™s glance.

â€œOK buddy. I will. I promise.â€

Dr. Dave departed this world this last July. I miss you my friend. What a time we had!

(Present Day) - 10/27/2025

Once again I find myself here at the entrepreneurial crossroads, feeling the need to practice what I preach, to pursue bliss, to dedicate time and life to doing what I love and what brings joy to the world around me - cooking, traveling, bringing people together (sometimes bringing them with me), discovering amazing places, amazing wines and unforgettable experiences, to not let lifeâ€™s everyday matters consume them. What started as a weekend hobby has become an all consuming passion.

For the last three years, I have run a mentoring program for innovators and entrepreneurs. I love it and Iâ€™ll never give it up. Thereâ€™s a lot of science and operational work but at its core, I simply get to encourage and guide those who are willing to make the navigational leap to a self-propelled future. Embracing this same thing again myself feels all the more rewarding.

So, here it comes, (sound the Barbaric Yawp) JoePlates, Inc. What started as fun weekend work and occasional traveling chef commissions has become an all consuming passion, to build community, elevate life and connect people to each other with amazing food and wine and life experiences, and to have insane amounts of fun doing so..

Give us a call and a chance to delight you. Let us bring the world to your table. Meanwhile, JoePlates, Inc. Is off and running. The calendar is filling up and the travel schedule is already looking exciting.

Sometimes, you just have to make the leap. Just tell me where to meet you.


[caption id="" align="alignnone" width="4032"] Me (left) and Dr. Dave (right), Bordeaux, France [/caption]
item.excerpt:encoded: It all begins with an idea.
item.dc:creator: jrohan66@gmail.com

item.title: The Kickoff
item.content:encoded:
July 2, 2025

Sooner or later you just have to embrace who you truly are and do what you love, or spend your days faking it the best you can at something else. This isnâ€™t the first time I have preached this to myself and others but on one particularly hot day earlier this year, it felt exceptionally loud and disruptive to everything else. I had spent the last 5 years coaching young entrepreneurs to do the same, and finally realized it was time again for me to drink my own Koolaid. Do what you love! Do what you are good at! Make what you love your work!

For all my love of the entrepreneurial journey in all forms, NOTHING makes me feel better than connecting people to each other and unforgettable life experiences through food, wine, travel and anything under the sun that enhances quality of life and happiness. Itâ€™s the one thing that consistently rings the tuning fork of life for me. It always has - and in the current day, at a time when real human intimacy continues to be threatened and diluted by a noisy and robotic world, breaking bread, traveling and spending quality time together seem to be its most resilient protectors.

 

Through every chapter of my own life, I have pursued this belief to every corner of the world, always savoring, always learning, always scheming on how I can capture and bring these moments to other people with full flavor and authenticity. From late night croquetas in Seville, Spain to that amazing meal you had on the coast of Maine, every snapshot of life becomes a moment to be shared.

Whether itâ€™s a wine-themed dinner celebrating the culinary regions of France, curating a private wine cellar, organizing a custom designed travel adventure, or a guided hike through the scenic Highlands of Scotland, creating unforgettable moments for people is what life prepared me for. Conveniently, it is also my greatest passion. Iâ€™m excited to share the road with you.
item.excerpt:encoded:
Some of lifeâ€™s greatest blessings truly come from our most difficult experiences. I know that sounds cliche but sometimes it just rings too loud and true to replace with catchier words.

On August 1st, 2025 I lost my best friend to cancer. November is soon to arrive. It still hurts. At least once every day I feel his absence, I feel the loss. I miss my friend.

Dave, or, Dr. Dave as we all knew him was a rare soul, kind, insanely intelligent, insanely generous and goofy like a pre-teen (his most endearing quality). For the last two years of his life I was his personal chef, brother-in-faith, travel buddy and at times, wingman in the endless physical, emotional and yes, endless psychological mind games that accompany the cancer experience. Almost all of the time, Dr. Dave seemed impenetrable to these things, except for those rare moments where being human just wins the toss.

I have loved to cook for most of my life, but NOTHING was as fun as cooking for Dr. Dave. He ate like I do. He loved wine with the same delicious obsession that I do. He reveled in human camaraderie the same way I do. There was no regular routine with Dr. Dave. There was spontanaiety and cravings, and travel plans that fed these cravings, and we ATE, like kings of the world, til the very end, where dining was one of Dr. Daveâ€™s few remaining freedoms. There was bone-in ribeye and duck and foit
item.dc:creator: jrohan66@gmail.com

item.title: An Opening Memory
item.content:encoded:
Some of lifeâ€™s greatest blessings truly come from our most difficult experiences. I know that sounds cliche but sometimes it just rings too loud and true to replace with catchier words.

On August 1st, 2025 I lost my best friend to cancer. November is soon to arrive. It still hurts. At least once every day I feel his absence, I feel the loss. I miss my friend.

Dave, or, Dr. Dave as we all knew him was a rare soul, kind, insanely intelligent, insanely generous and goofy like a pre-teen (his most endearing quality). For the last two years of his life I was his personal chef, brother-in-faith, travel buddy and at times, wingman in the endless physical, emotional and yes, endless psychological mind games that accompany the cancer experience. Almost all of the time, Dr. Dave seemed impenetrable to these things, except for those rare moments where being human just wins the toss.

I have loved to cook for most of my life, but NOTHING was as fun as cooking for Dr. Dave. He ate like I do. He loved wine with the same delicious obsession that I do. He reveled in human camaraderie the same way I do. There was no regular routine with Dr. Dave. There was spontanaiety and cravings, and travel plans that fed these cravings, and we ATE, like kings of the world, til the very end, where dining was one of Dr. Daveâ€™s few remaining freedoms. There was bone-in ribeye and duck and foie gras, and fresh pasta with black truffle and pork and salmon. There was no boundary with Dr. Dave, no limit on experimentation or first tries. He loved it all as generously to himself as he was to anyone who encountered him.

And so our dynamic and the good feelings and the conviviality became contagious, to friends, family, anyone who connected. Our gatherings and wanderings and the connections that they fostered became The community that formed around our group became the model for what I hope to continue creating within JoePlates, Inc. the kind of gatherings and connections between people, the kind of raw gratitude and support, all of it.

Sitting together in Bordeaux, France one night in October 2023, Dr. Dave sipped his wine and gave me a hard look over his glass.

â€œYou have to keep doing this, after Iâ€™m gone I mean. Promise me, you will keep doing this. I mean, just look what this does, for me, for people. People need this! And look how much fun you have doing this. Itâ€™s like you were born to do this.

Heâ€™s was right, Whenever

item.title: Blog Post Title Three
item.content:encoded:
It all begins with an idea. Maybe you want to launch a business. Maybe you want to turn a hobby into something more. Or maybe you have a creative project to share with the world. Whatever it is, the way you tell your story online can make all the difference.

Donâ€™t worry about sounding professional. Sound like you. There are over 1.5 billion websites out there, but your story is whatâ€™s going to separate this one from the rest. If you read the words back and donâ€™t hear your own voice in your head, thatâ€™s a good sign you still have more work to do.

Be clear, be confident and donâ€™t overthink it. The beauty of your story is that itâ€™s going to continue to evolve and your site can evolve with it. Your goal should be to make it feel right for right now. Later will take care of itself. It always does.

Donâ€™t worry about sounding professional. Sound like you. There are over 1.5 billion websites out there, but your story is whatâ€™s going to separate this one from the rest. If you read the words back and donâ€™t hear your own voice in your head, thatâ€™s a good sign you still have more work to do.

Be clear, be confident and donâ€™t overthink it. The beauty of your story is that itâ€™s going to continue to evolve and your site can evolve with it. Your goal should be to make it feel right for right now. Later will take care of itself. It always does.

What started as a weekend hobby has become an all consuming passion.

For the last three years, I have run a mentoring program for innovators and entrepreneurs. I love it and Iâ€™ll never give it up. Thereâ€™s a lot of science and operational work but at its core, I simply get to encourage and guide those who are willing to make the navigational leap to a self-propelled future. Embracing this same thing again myself feels all the more rewarding.

So, here it comes, (insert my Barbaric Yawp) JoePlates, Inc. What started as a weekend work and occasional traveling chef commissions has become a compelling next chapter with a compelling vision, to build community, elevate life and connect people to each other through amazing food, wine and life experiences. Give us a call and a chance to delight you. Let us bring the world to your table. Meanwhile, JoePlates, Inc. Is off and running. item.title: Dining Themes
item.content:encoded:
Dining Themes

We donâ€™t just plan great dining events, we curate memorable life moments. We bring the world to your table, anywhere in the world. Thatâ€™s right, weâ€™ll meet you anywhere!

Multiple-courses, each paired meticulously with its perfect wine, spirit or non-alcoholic compliment, curated from our world wanderings and brought to your table.

Pick from the list of worldwide themes below, or customize your own.

  • No Reservations

    An intensional collision of amazing flavors from worldwide regions. Start with a Vietnamese-infused Tuna Carpaccio. Finish with a filet of boeuf with a rich black truffle madeira sauce. Anything goes in between.

  • A Night in Seville

    Spanish tapas and the small plate concept is my eternal rabbit hole and my favorite way to dine. The landscape of flavors and texture found in Spanish nightlife and in the tapas culture are endless and boundless.  Weâ€™ll start with some specially sourced Pata Negra Serrano Ham and Spanish Cod Croquetas and keep the flavors coming.

  • Tour de France

    Getting lost in French cuisine is as fun as getting lost in France itself. From regional food and wine themes to an unrestrained and broad sampling from Bordeaux to Paris to the Alsace, French food and wine is a bottomless sea of history, flavor and depth.

  • Lost in Italy

    Likewise, Italy is a delightful abyss of food and wine micro-cultures. Across multiple courses, we will dive in recklessly but come out with a spectacular finish. Consider requesting wine pairings for this meal.

  • Northwest Passage

    From world renowned Pinot Noirs and Chardonnays to coastal seafood treasures and coveted black and white truffles, the Pacific Northwest (Oregon/Washington) is a food and wine loverâ€™s paradise. It is also my second home in the U.S.

  • New York, New York

    Viva Manhattan - Big City Decadence.  A five course parade of exquisite courses and pairing that would rival any New York steakhouse.

  • South by Southwest

    Carolina to Texas, by way of Louisiana. A celebration of American Southern and Southwest cooking from Southern grits to swamp bits to tangy and tasty Texas barbecue.

  • The Maine Event

    A fun and elegant twist on a timeless New England lobster bake tradition.

  • The Highlander

    The Scottish Highlands are where I go when I need to feel small again, in the best way. Itâ€™s all wind, mist, and magic. Yet tucked among those remote hills are inns and tables serving salmon pulled from nearby rivers, and oysters kissed by cold seas, and venison that tastes as pristine as the land itself. The wild feeds you, body and soul.

  • The Faces of Champagne

    It started as a fascination, now itâ€™s a full-blown obsession. Champagne isnâ€™t just a celebration drink to me; itâ€™s a way of seeing food through a more refined lens. Over the years, Iâ€™ve come to admire its incredible versatility â€” the way a brut rosÃ© can stand up to duck and lamb, or how a vintage blanc de blancs elevates a simple oyster or popcorn to something transcendent.

    Champagne brings energy, elegance, and unexpected harmony to the table. From caviar to fried chicken, I love how champagne can push the boundaries, and to build entire dinners around these magic bubbles. These arenâ€™t just meals â€” theyâ€™re life events. And once you experience Champagne on its own terms, there's no going back.

  • Papa Hemingway

    Celebrate the favorite dishes of Ernest Hemingway from his celebrated work, A Moveable Feast and other famous Hemingway moments.

  • Of the Sea

    Nine years afloat will change your sense of time â€” and taste. From king salmon pulled fresh from Alaskan waters to spiny lobsters grilled over beach fires in the Out Islands, the sea has fed me in ways no spit of land ever could. Dodging storms in Bermuda, watching the Atlantic turn indigo, filleting freshly speared grouper â€” these memories pulse through me everyday. My affection for the sea runs deep, not just for its flavors, but for its wildness, its generosity, its constant motion. A reminder that all things from the sea, even our own survival on stormy days, are a gift.


  • Island Heat

    I get quickly and blissfully lost hereâ€¦â€¦â€¦.and I like it. I like it because of so much life history, so many fond memories of the island, and so many limitless options - and we can pick from any and all of it. From Puerto Rican pork to flying fish from barbados and timeless Cuban black beans and rice.  So, we will just go nuts, and plan this together. At some point, something will arrive wrapped in a banana leaf the likelihood of rum and fruit is extremely high. Every time I do this theme, itâ€™s unbeivably fun, and never completely the same.

  • Stew On It

    I love slow-cooked food, for so many reasons but starting with the fact that almost every global region has something to offer, Alsatian choucroute, 12 hr. short ribs, Cuban pork shoulder - almost everyone has their spin on the slow roast. Itâ€™s intimate, comforting and can be dressed up and down from a side street pop-up food truck to a Michelin-starred experience. Pairing wines with these beautiful dishes is as much fun as preparing the food.


  • Speakeasy Secrets

    The Prohibition period was full of decadent flavor and rich foods that would mask the smell of alcohol. Enjoy a vast spread of â€œheavy appetizersâ€ (small bites that will comprise a full meal experience) - from deviled eggs to duck confit, rich flavors await you.

  • Ode to Mushrooms

    From the haunting perfume of truffle to the meaty heft of porcini and the honeycomb delicacy of morels, mushrooms carry the forest into the kitchen. Theyâ€™re shapeshifters, soaking in umami like sponges, yet also capable of holding their own as vessels for butter, smoke, wine, and stock. A roasted morel filled with cream and herbs, a seared porcini that tastes of both earth and branch . In mushrooms, one finds both memory and mystery. They are natureâ€™s own flavor architects.

  • Vegetarian / Vegan

    Vegetarian and/or vegan options and full meal plans available.

  • Cocktail and Craft Spirit Themes

    Want to build a menu around world class bourbon, scotch, tequila or your favorite craft beers. We love it. Just inquire.

Subscribe to Our Newsletter

Sign up with your email address to receive news and updates.

Thank you!

item.title: Blog Post Title Four
item.content:encoded:
It all begins with an idea. Maybe you want to launch a business. Maybe you want to turn a hobby into something more. Or maybe you have a creative project to share with the world. Whatever it is, the way you tell your story online can make all the difference.

Donâ€™t worry about sounding professional. Sound like you. There are over 1.5 billion websites out there, but your story is whatâ€™s going to separate this one from the rest. If you read the words back and donâ€™t hear your own voice in your head, thatâ€™s a good sign you still have more work to do.

Be clear, be confident and donâ€™t overthink it. The beauty of your story is that itâ€™s going to continue to evolve and your site can evolve with it. Your goal should be to make it feel right for right now. Later will take care of itself. It always does.
item.excerpt:encoded: It all begins with an idea.
item.dc:creator: jrohan66@gmail.com
